Detailed Description

Class containing a level and every functions about it.

Positions in grid start in the upper-left corner with (m=0,n=0).

Example : (2,4) means third rows and fifth cols starting in the upper-left corner.

Grid is made like this in loaded files :

##### # -> wall # # $ -> box #$ # . -> goal ### $## * -> box on a goal (not in this figure) # $ $ # @ -> pusher ### # ## # ###### + -> pusher on a goal # # ## ##### ..# s -> inside ground (generated by recursive # $ $ ..# algorithm in program memory ##### ### ### ..# # ######### #######

const int  n 
) const

Read the value of position (m,n). Position start in the upper-left corner of the grid with (0,0).

Parameters:
m Row number.
n Col number.
Returns:
Value of position (m,n) or 'E' if pos is out of grid.

Read the value of position "pos" of the grid. Position start in the upper-left corner of the grid with (0,0).

Parameters:
pos Absolute position in the grid
Returns:
Value of position pos or 'E' if pos is out of grid.

int Level::move ( const char  direction  ) 

Move the pusher in a given direction and save it in the actualPath

Parameters:
direction Direction where to move the pusher (u,d,l,r,U,D,L,R)
Returns:
Level::MOUV_NONE if no move. Level::MOUV_SOKOBAN if normal move. Level::MOUV_BOX if box move.

int Level::eraseMove ( void   ) 

Move the pusher backward and erase last move in the actualPath

Returns:
Level::MOUV_NONE if no move. Level::MOUV_SOKOBAN if normal move. Level::MOUV_BOX if box move.

void Level::initializePusherPos ( void   )  [protected]

Initialize (find) starting position of pusher to store it in this object

void Level::makeGround ( void   )  [protected]

Transform empty spaces inside level in ground represented by 's' used to draw the level. Call to recursive function "makeFloorRec".

void Level::makeGroundRec ( const int  m,
const int  n 
) [protected]

Recursive function used to transform inside spaces by ground ('s') started with initial position of sokoban. NEVER use this function directly. Use makeFloor instead.

Parameters:
m Rows number (start with sokoban position)
n Cols number (start with sokoban position)

void Level::copyLevel ( const Level *  source  )  [protected]

Copy other level in this object. Used by constructor.

Parameters:
source level to be copied in this object.

void Level::printInFile ( const char *  fileName  )  const [protected]

Print level in text mode in a file or in the shell.

Parameters:
fileName name of the file we want to print in. If NULL, then it will be print on screen (standard output)

void Level::xmlLoad ( xmlNodePtr  levelNode,
xmlNodePtr  pathNode,
const int  id 
) [protected]

Parse the Level part of a XML file (between <Level> and </Level>)

Parameters:
levelNode Position in XML file where we can load a level (<Level>)
pathNode Position in second XML file (the one with best paths assigned to a particular player)
id Number of the level in the pack (starting with "1")
